column4: I'm currently running xubuntu but I have some problems with packages when installing not-apt-get programs and I'm currently thinking maybe debian would be better in that case... what do you guys think?
I pick ubunutu server over debian these days.
I'm happy with ubuntu on my lappy.
then it sounds like you have a special case.
I had a similar problem when I wanted to install cinelerra a year or so ago
welcome to the wonderful world of computers.
of course it's possible for packages to conflict.
maybe it has something to do with a difference between ubuntu and xubuntu install, because the .deb file I downloaded for the program was made for ubuntu edgy
if you find .deb that don't have some of the dependencies, my usual mode of operation is to start hunting for clues by googling for the errormessages I'm getting.
It just gives dependency probs (Package python-dbus is not installed. AND  Package python-gnome2-extras is not installed.)
what happens when you install those?
for python-dbus: when looking in synaptic, "python2.3-dbus" is installed
sorry.  Wish I could be more help.  do you have universe and multiverse repositories enabled?
I'm using (normally :P) the repositories of ubuntuguide.org
You're not going to believe this, I uncommented original sources again....and scribus just is in apt-get... just installed... just spent 4 hours on that...
